page.title: 05Farming
page.content:
Stone Walling My father, grandfather and brother build stone walls and erect fences and gates. When building stone walls, the stones must overlap.The middle cavity is filled with small stones and every two metres there should be a through stone to 'tie' the two sides together.They cement the coping or top stones on for added strength. { }Most of their work is in repairing old walls. Very few new walls are built. Some of the work is in landscaping gardens and they help in the erection of equipment and fences for Alwinton Border Shepherds Show.
